judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment of the court below, entered for want of a sufficient affidavit of defense, is affirmed on the opinion of Judge Brown.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Abraham M. Rose, with him John Swartz and Eli J. Rose, for appellant.
Boyd Lee Spahr, of Ballard, Spahr, Andrews & Ingersoll, with him David S. Malis, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Davis v. Seltzer, Appellant.
Argued December 7, 1933.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
January 2, 1934:
Abraham M. Rose, with him John Swartz and Eli J. Rose, for appellant.
Boyd Lee Spahr, of Ballard, Spahr, Andrews & Ingersoll, with him David S. Malis, for appellee.
